name: WASP-57
scenarioDescription:
The WASP-57 Exoplanetary System


Overview

WASP-57 is a star with 0.89 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.93 times its radius. It is located 1313.756368 light years away from the solar system.

WASP-57 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the WASP-57 system

WASP-57 b

WASP-57 b was discovered by the SuperWASP observatory using the Transit method. The mass of WASP-57 b is 204.68252 times the mass of Earth. The radius of WASP-57 b is 11.769 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, WASP-57 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system. At more than 50 Earth masses, WASP-57 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system WASP-57, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by SuperWASP.
